poem:
**Mediterranean Crossings**

In the shadowed wake  
of fishing boats,  
hope clings to salt-slicked skin—  
3,800 poems untold,  
writ by the wind and wail of water.  
Freedom's mirage  
twists in ruthless tides  
but still they sail,  
human cargo seeking light  
beyond the horizon's unyielding line,  
as nets of greed are cast  
with indifferent hands.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK-based people smuggler jailed for 25 years over Mediterranean crossings A people smuggler based in the UK who helped to “ruthlessly and cynically” exploit people seeking asylum as part of a £12m Mediterranean operation has been jailed for 25 years. Ahmed Ebid, 42, helped bring nearly 3,800 people, including women and children, on just seven fishing boat crossings from north Africa to Italy between October 2022 and June 2023, the National Crime Agency (NCA) said.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
